==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Etymology 1===
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*b-r-gjat ~ b-g-rjat|*b-r-gjat|eight}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{zh-pron
|m=bā
|c=baat3
|cat=num
}}

====Definitions====
{{zh-hanzi}}

# an [[:w:Chinese numbers#Numeral characters|accounting version]] of the numeral eight that is otherwise written as {{zh-l|八|tr=-}}

===Etymology 2===
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*brat ~ prat|*brat|cut apart, cut open}}. Cognate to {{zh-m|*別}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{zh-pron
|m=bā
|c=baat3
|mc=y
|oc=y
|cat=v,n
}}

====Definitions====
{{zh-hanzi}}

# {{zh-alt-form|朳|toothless rake}}
# {{zh-alt-form|扒|to break open, split open}}

===Etymology 3===
{{zh-forms|alt=別,八,仈,白,識-"to know",曾-"already"}}
Min dialectal word for "to know".

Austroasiatic substrate influence; may be related to {{zh-m|*別|to split; to differentiate}}. Cognate with {{cog|vi|biết||to know}}, {{cog|mtq|mắt||to know}}, Proto-Bahnaric ''*băt'' ("to remember, to know"), {{cog|hmx-pro|*pei||to know}} ({{cog|mww|paub||to know, to understand}}).

Many variant written forms exist, but {{lang|zh|捌}} is [http://twblg.dict.edu.tw/holodict_new/iongji/pdf/annesia294pdf.pdf recommended] by Taiwan's Ministry of Education.

====Pronunciation====
{{zh-pron
|md=báik
|mn=xm,qz,zz,tp,lk,sx,km,mg,hc:pat/xm,zz,kh,tn,yl,tc:bat
|mn_note=Zhangzhou: pat - only “to know”
|mn-t=bag4
|cat=v,adv
}}

====Definitions====
{{zh-hanzi}} {{tlb|zh|Min}}

# to [[know]]; to [[recognise]]; to be [[familiar]] with
#: {{zh-x|捌字|to '''know''' how to read|tr=báik-cê|MD}}
# to [[know]] (somebody)
#: {{zh-x|伓捌|to not '''know''' (someone)|tr=n̂g-báik|MD}}
# [[already]]; [[previously]]
#: {{zh-x|捌曾|''a term denoting past tense''|tr=báik-cèng|MD}}
#: {{zh-x|捌{bat} 做 %過{kòe}|to have done something '''already'''|MN}}
